NATS
National Airspace Trajectory-Prediction System
Aircraft TRX File and Flight Plan

NATS TRX files are used for inputting flight record data to NATS engine. They are defined as two types of files:

  • Track data file: File containing track-related information. This file must be ended with “.trx”
  • MFL data file: File containing maximum-flight-level information. This file must be ended with “.trx”

Topics to cover about TRX file:

Aircraft TRX Track Data File
TRX MFL File
Detail Rules of Aircraft TRX Track Data File
How to Produce Aircraft TRX FP_ROUTE Data?

Aircraft TRX Track Data File

The format of this TRX file is illustrated below. It has the following three rows:

  • TRACK_TIME: This is the timestamp for which the flight data is presented.
  • TRACK: This row has the flight parameters in the following format: (callsign, aircraft type, latitude x, longitude y, airspeed, altitude level, course heading , ARTCC , ARTCCSector) Note: The heading is in degree, airspeed in knots, the altitude level is in 100 feet (Eg. 350 for 35,000ft. The latitude and longitude should be positive values, NATS intrinsically calculates the polarity. The latitude and longitude format is in degree-minute-second. For high accuracy, using decimal digit for second value is acceptable, like 373638.1234. For flights on ground at the departure airport, the altitude level needs to be 0 or the origin airport elevation.
  • FP_ROUTE: This is the flight plan, with the departure and arrival airports in green, SID(Standard Instrument Departure)/STAR(Standard Terminal Approach Route) procedures in yellow, approach procedure in pink, departure and arrival runways in grey, and the enroute waypoints in red. In addition to this, for the NATS augmented flight plan, the departure taxi procedure is in blue, and the arrival taxi procedure is in orange.

FAA SWIM TRX Record

TRACK_TIME 1121238067
TRACK ULI-3AFSD3DC24 B733 373638 1222286 130 0 28 ZOA ZOA46
FP_ROUTE KSFO./.SSTIK3.LOSHN..BOILE..BLH.ARLIN4.I25L.KPHX

NATS Augmented TRX Record

TRACK_TIME 1121238067
TRACK ULI-3AFSD3DC24 B733 373638 1222286 130 0 28 ZOA ZOA46
FP_ROUTE KSFO. <{"id": "Gate_A_006"}, {"id": "Ramp_01_001"},{"id": "Ramp_01_002"}, {"id": "Ramp_01_003"}, {"id":"Ramp_01_004"}, {"id": "Ramp_01_005"}, {"id": "Ramp_01_006"},{"id": "Ramp_01_007"}, {"id": "Txy_M_H"}, {"id": "Txy_M_001"},{"id": "Txy_A_M"}, {"id": "Txy_A_003"}, {"id": "Txy_A_002"},{"id": "Txy_A_A1"}, {"id": "Txy_A_001"}, {"id": "Rwy_02_001"},{"id":"Rwy_02_002"}>. KPHX

TRX MFL File

The number of records in this file must match the number of aircraft in the TRX track data file. Each line represents an aircraft with the maximum flight level value in 100 feet.

Example: ULI-3AFSD3DC24 320
